title: Arrested man, 24, on the run after escaping from cops at hospital

content:
The suspect has some distinctive features the public can look out for

COP MANHUNT Arrested man, 24, on the run after escaping from cops during treatment at hospital

A BURGLARY suspect is on the run after escaping from police while receiving treatment at hospital.

Jon Michael Lee, 24, was arrested on suspicion of driving offences and burglary but taken to the John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford.

It was there he managed to slip away from officers and escape on Friday afternoon.

He was last seen on Headley Way, Oxford, after legging it at around 3:45pm.

Lee is described as a white male, around 5ft 11ins tall, with short brown hair, brown eyes, a short moustache and a small beard.

He has a tattoo of two cherries on his left cheekbone.

Detective Inspector Marcia Hardy, said: “We are carrying out extensive enquiries to trace Jon Lee.

“We would ask anyone who sees him to please call 999 rather than approaching him, or if you have information as to his whereabouts please call 101.

summary: A 24-year-old man, Jon Michael Lee, has escaped from police after being arrested on suspicion of driving offences and burglary at the John Radcliffe Hospital in Oxford, England. He is described as a white male, around 5ft 11ins tall, with short brown hair, brown eyes, a short moustache and a small beard. The suspect was last seen on Headley Way, Oxford, after escaping from officers at around 3:45pm. Police are currently conducting extensive enquiries to trace Lee.
shortSummary: A 24-year-old man is on the run from police after escaping during treatment for multiple crimes, including burglary.
